trustfund:
TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outocme is assessed as
            satisfactory, while sustainability is likely. Bank
            performance is rated satisfactory. Borrower performance
            overall is considered satisfactory in the implementation of
            the program, especially with respect to perseverance in
            carrying out the program once economic conditions
            deteriorated and in the face of domestic opposition. A
            stable social and political environment is essential to
            support macroeconomic and structural reforms. The government
            made good progress during the early phase of the project,
            but increasingly, in the face of domestic opposition,
            political instability, civil unrest and a mutiny, program
            implementation became more arduous during 2001. Other
            lessons learned include these: Careful investment in
            preparation to ensure strong ownership and build counterpart
            commitment and understanding are important to maintain
            reform momentum. It was worth taking the risk of involvement
            in a new adjustment program once the new government had
            established its reformist credentials, notwithstanding the
            poor track record of reforms of previous governments. When
            counterpart capacity is not strong, close and frequent
            supervision by the Bank is neded to achieve program
            completion. The burden of program implementation would have
            been considerably eased and made smoother if a more formal
            and extensive mechanism had been established in government
            with responsibility for program implementation.
